programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how lions hunt large prey like buffalo and zebra, offering new perspectives on the way these predators stalk, chase and kill. A lone lioness relies on cunning to feed her newborn cubs, whilst a fearless pride tries to take down the biggest prey of all, a giant African elephant. .

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how wolf packs hunt prey, offering new perspectives on the way they work together to locate, isolate and bring down large bison and musk oxen. An arctic wolf pack must make a kill before the harsh winter arrives, while further south, grey wolves take on prey 10 times their size.

programme.title: Alaska's Deadliest
programme.desc: Alaska's wild waters are home to some of the deadliest seafarers on the planet. Fanged and fierce jaws surface from the sea and unleash their fury on the waterways. Shores of open ocean create a path for giant hunters like orcas and salmon sharks. And its deep-water channels hide tiny ocean terrors, who compensate their size with sophisticated weaponry equipped to stun, shock and poison..

programme.title: Predator V Prey

programme.title: The Incredible Pol Farm

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin heads into the constant heat, humidity and rainfall of the Australian rainforests to find out what it takes to be ‚ÄúBuilt to Survive.‚Äù In the leafy canopy, Phil encounters the elusive tree kangaroo and its young joey, as well as Australia‚Äôs largest snake, the lethal scrub python. On the forest floor, the colorful cassowary acts as the rainforest‚Äôs gardener.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Within the Channel Country deserts, Indigenous educator Phil Breslin scours the endless sands to find three animals that not only survive the heat but thrive in unrelenting conditions. Get ready to meet Australia‚Äôs most impressive animals: the perentie, the continent‚Äôs largest lizard; the emu, its fastest flightless bird; and the mighty red kangaroo, the world‚Äôs largest marsupial.

programme.title: Ultimate Rivals: Cats vs Dogs
programme.desc: Canines and felines have been living side by side in Africa for hundreds of thousands of years, and they've never really gotten along-not even amongst themselves. Throw the hyena into the mix and they're all nightmare neighbors? Stealing from each other; harassing each other; eating each other's young. Avoidance might be the only way to stay alive.
